alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 4:51PM MST until August 18 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... portions of the Grand Canyon in Coconino County, Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 447 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near and over the Grand Canyon. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Desert View at Grand Canyon, Moran Point At Grand Canyon, Cape Royal At Grand Canyon, Grandview Point At Grand Canyon, Shoshone Point At Grand Canyon, Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, Grand Canyon National Park and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 64 between mile markers 269 and 283. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cremation Creek, Lee Canyon, Cardenas Creek, Burro Canyon Wash, Colorado River, Comanche Creek, Grapevine Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Clear Creek, Bekihatso Wash, Deer Tank Wash, Little Colorado River, Unkar Creek, Sheep Wash, Bright Angel Creek, Bright Angel Wash, Pipe Creek, Moenkopi Wash, and Tappan Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
